qas.question: Who established the framework for quantum mechanics?
What paper did von Neumann produce in 1932?
What von Neumann work preceded the axiomatiztion of quatum mechanics?

context: <a0_0>Von Neumann<a0_0/> was the first to establish a rigorous mathematical framework for quantum mechanics, known as the Dirac–von Neumann axioms, with his 1932 work <a1_0>Mathematical Foundations of Quantum Mechanics<a1_0/>. After having completed the <a2_0>axiomatization of set theory<a2_0/>, he began to confront the axiomatization of quantum mechanics. He realized, in 1926, that a state of a quantum system could be represented by a point in a (complex) Hilbert space that, in general, could be infinite-dimensional even for a single particle. In this formalism of quantum mechanics, observable quantities such as position or momentum are represented as linear operators acting on the Hilbert space associated with the quantum system.
